main event: A group of lights, described as a 'flying wheel', was observed in the sky over Nebraska in 1958.
interesting points: The object had approximately 20 rotating red and green lights arranged in a circular formation.
The lights rotated in a counter-clockwise direction, with the plane they rotated in being almost parallel to the ground.
The object was much larger than a normal aircraft and moved much slower.
Attempts were made to intercept the object with a USAF aircraft, but no positive identification could be made.
Multiple trained observers, including civilians and military personnel, reported seeing the strange lights.
sighted object: a group of rotating red and green lights in a circular formation
location: Eddyville, Broken Bow, and Miller, Nebraska
witnesses: farmers, housewives, telephone operators, postal worker, and military personnel
